title.en: How humans got the first fire

transcript.default: čuu ʔuuqḥɬiʔaqƛs qʷisḥitiič quuʔas hiniip ʔink.

transcription.default: čuu ʔuuqḥɬiʔaqƛs qʷisḥitiič quuʔas hiniip ʔink

utterances.translation: OK, I will talk about how people got fire.
Long ago humans didn’t have fire.
There was no fire to cook their meals.
Only the wolf tribe had fire.
People were scared of the wolf tribe.
Many times people tried to get the fire [from the wolf tribe].
But none of them can ever get close [to the fire].
Time and time again different men tried but they would all come back and say the same thing, “It couldn’t be done.”

transcript.default: čaa waa kaƛḥšiƛ hisumyisʔiswaʔiš ḥaa muwaačm̓it ʔumč̓aap.

transcription.default: čaa waa kaƛḥšiƛ hisumyisʔiswaʔiš ḥaa muwaačm̓it ʔumč̓aap

utterances.translation: Now, one day Son of Deer was playing down on the beach.

transcript.default: naʔaa ʔan ciiqciiqa ḥaa ʔuuʔasm̓inḥʔi čaakupiiḥ ʔanč wim̓aaqƛ̓at ƛawiičiʔat hiy̓atʔitq qʷayac̓iikštaqumɬ.

transcription.default: naʔaa ʔan ciiqciiqa ḥaa ʔuuʔasm̓inḥʔi čaakupiiḥ ʔanč wim̓aaqƛ̓at ƛawiičiʔat hiy̓atʔitq qʷayac̓iikštaqumɬ

utterances.translation: He could hear the people saying that it was impossible to get close to the wolf village.

transcript.default: yacinsʔiiʔaƛ qučknaḥiy̓uɬʔisʔi muwaačm̓it ʔuʔumḥis hiinipčip siiḥiɬ.

transcription.default: yacinsʔiiʔaƛ qučknaḥiy̓uɬʔisʔi muwaačm̓it ʔuʔumḥis hiinipčip siiḥiɬ

utterances.translation: Son of Deer walked to the people and said in the small voice, “I can get it for you.”
They laughed at Son of Deer.

transcript.default: ʔaqisḥcumč ʔuʕašt waaʔaƛ̓at, wim̓aaqƛukna haa ʔaʔiiḥp̓itukqin hiinip ʔinkʔii, ƛ̓iixc̓uy̓inʔaƛ.

transcription.default: ʔaqisḥcumč ʔuʕašt waaʔaƛ̓at wim̓aaqƛukna haa ʔaʔiiḥp̓itukqin hiinip ʔinkʔii ƛ̓iixc̓uy̓inʔaƛ

utterances.translation: “How can he be the one to get [the fire for us] when our big guys could not get it?” they said laughing at him.

transcript.default: huʔaasʔaƛƛa waa muwaačm̓it hiinipčipʔaqƛ siiḥiɬ ʔink waa.

transcription.default: huʔaasʔaƛƛa waa muwaačm̓it hiinipčipʔaqƛ siiḥiɬ ʔink waa

utterances.translation: Son of Deer said again, “I will go and get fire for you.”
They started to laugh at him again.
“Oh, let him try,” said the chief.
“OK,” they said to him.
Now the little Son of Deer sure got proud and happy.
“OK, get some dancing gear for me.
I will need skirt, head band, wrist bands, and knee bands.”
“Make them for him. Make for him whatever he needs,” said the chief.
Then the ladies started working.
It didn’t take long to get the costumes made.
Son of Deer got dressed.

transcript.default: čuu ʔusumʔaqƛsiš yaqʔaqƛii nunuuk waaʔaƛ muwaačm̓it kutḥsii.

transcription.default: čuu ʔusumʔaqƛsiš yaqʔaqƛii nunuuk waaʔaƛ muwaačm̓it kutḥsii

utterances.translation: “Now, I will need someone who will sing and drum.
They will come with me, but you must all go ahead,” he said.
He started to walk, singing and drumming along.

transcript.default: čuu, ʔiiqḥukʔaqƛs siiḥiɬ qʷiyuʔaqƛiisuu kamatqšiƛ waaʔaƛ.

transcription.default: čuu ʔiiqḥukʔaqƛs siiḥiɬ qʷiyuʔaqƛiisuu kamatqšiƛ waaʔaƛ

utterances.translation: “OK, I will tell you all when you will start running,” he said.
The little one was hiding as they went along with the singers.
Now they got close to where the wolf tribe lived.
“OK you all, run and go home,” said Son of Deer.
The singers all ran.
Son of Deer started to sing and dance.
The wolf tribe were looking at him.
“What is it?” said the chief of the wolf tribe.

transcript.default: haa, ʔuḥʔisʔiš muwaačm̓it šuuɬhuuɬa ʔiinaxyuʔis waaʔaƛ qʷayac̓iik.

transcription.default: haa ʔuḥʔisʔiš muwaačm̓it šuuɬhuuɬa ʔiinaxyuʔis waaʔaƛ qʷayac̓iik

utterances.translation: “Well, it is Son of Deer dancing in costume,” said one of the wolves.
“Go and get him away from here” [said the wolf chief].
“Go away. Get away,” they said.

transcript.default: haa, wiinapap̓i waaʔaƛ ɬuucmaakʔi ḥaw̓iɬʔi wiinapap̓i.

transcription.default: haa wiinapap̓i waaʔaƛ ɬuucmaakʔi ḥaw̓iɬʔi wiinapap̓i

utterances.translation: “Oh, let him stay,” said the chief’s wife.
“He is so cute. Let him dance as he wants,” she said.
“OK, let him in,” said the chief.
They let him in.
Son of Deer started to dance.

transcript.default: paaʔiƛ kaɬa, paaʔiƛ kaɬa ʔee muwaačm̓it taɬa ʔee muwaačm̓it taɬa, wawaaʔisuk nuuk huuɬhuuɬa.

transcription.default: paaʔiƛ kaɬa paaʔiƛ kaɬa ʔee muwaačm̓it taɬa ʔee muwaačm̓it taɬa wawaaʔisuk nuuk huuɬhuuɬa

utterances.translation: “I’m going to get a spark of thefire. I’m going to get a spark of that fire,” said his song as he danced.

transcript.default: čuu qʷiyuyii ʔinxaa ʔuyickʷaƛ ʔaqʔištiik hišumy̓uup ƛ̓ušuk ḥumiis, ʔucaʔap̓aƛ ʔaḥ qay̓apt̓atʔi mamaƛp̓ičumʔatʔi.

transcription.default: čuu qʷiyuyii ʔinxaa ʔuyickʷaƛ ʔaqʔištiik hišumy̓uup ƛ̓ušuk ḥumiis ʔucaʔap̓aƛ ʔaḥ qay̓apt̓atʔi mamaƛp̓ičumʔatʔi

utterances.translation: Now, when he was getting ready, he bundled up dry cedar twigs and put it behind his knee in the knee band.
As he danced, he was trying to get closer and closer to the fire.

transcript.default: ƛaƛaʔis hamuut sasačk̓iḥta, hišaacu ḥaa ʔinkʔii, wim̓aaqƛ̓at ƛawiičiʔat.

transcription.default: ƛaƛaʔis hamuut sasačk̓iḥta hišaacu ḥaa ʔinkʔii wim̓aaqƛ̓at ƛawiičiʔat

utterances.translation: They had long stakes around the fire so that no one can get close to it.

transcript.default: ʔaanaḥi y̓ay̓aaqḥiʔis yayaacinkstisʔaƛ ḥaa, wik ʔuusuqta.

transcription.default: ʔaanaḥi y̓ay̓aaqḥiʔis yayaacinkstisʔaƛ ḥaa wik ʔuusuqta

utterances.translation: But with his long little legs, he could step between them without getting hurt.
Now he got close, and then he jumped over the fire.
The wolf tribe did not realize what he was doing.
Son of Deer jumped over the fire and started to run.
They didn’t realize that Deer got the fire.
The dry cedar twigs caught fire.
Son of Deer took the flame and obtained the fire and got back to where humans live.

transcript.default: ʔiiḥʔaƛ̓aɬ nučḥak ʔuʔumḥičiƛ̓aɬ siqiiɬ, ʔuʔumḥičiƛ kaƛḥʕaqstuƛuk ʔuʔumḥičiƛtaaɬʔis.

transcription.default: ʔiiḥʔaƛ̓aɬ nučḥak ʔuʔumḥičiƛ̓aɬ siqiiɬ ʔuʔumḥičiƛ kaƛḥʕaqstuƛuk ʔuʔumḥičiƛtaaɬʔis

utterances.translation: People were very happy — now they can cook, have light and heat.

transcript.default: ʔuy̓iiḥawaʔiš tupkak̓at muwač hiiɬtqyaap̓aɬ qay̓apt̓a, ʔunw̓iiƛḥ ʔan hiniicckʷi ʔinkʔii.

transcription.default: ʔuy̓iiḥawaʔiš tupkak̓at muwač hiiɬtqyaap̓aɬ qay̓apt̓a ʔunw̓iiƛḥ ʔan hiniicckʷi ʔinkʔii

utterances.translation: The reason that deer has a black spot behind his knee is because he brought back the fire.
That’s it.
